title: Peer Relationship Support Strategies for Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder in Inclusive Early Childhood Education Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Basic special education and early childhood education theories, understanding of inclusive education concepts
context.additional_context: Microlearning via smartphones for early childhood education practitioners to acquire field-applicable strategies

learning_goals: In an inclusive educational environment, peer relationship types (rejection, isolation, balance) of children with autism spectrum disorder can be analyzed.
Three protective factors (pairing rules, innovative curriculum, parental collaboration) for improving social interactions in children with ASD can be applied to actual educational activities.
Improvement strategies can be proposed for three factors (hierarchical roles, reliance on medical models, lack of expertise) that hinder peer relationship formation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
